docs.lead_paragraph: THE outfield at Thomas J. Dodd Stadium in Norwich was filled with more than 300 children playing games, eating hamburgers and painting a mural. On each of their shirts was a small name tag that also listed their weight at birth. Although they are healthy today, many of these children weighed only 2 or 3 pounds at birth and spent months in the neonatal intensive-care unit of Lawrence & Memorial Hospital in New London.

headline.main: The View From/Norwich; From Care to Laughter, A Hospital Celebrates

docs.abstract: Scene at Lawrence & Memorial Hospital in New London, Conn, described as children and doctors and nurses who cared for them celebrate neonatal unit's 10th anniversary; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Your writer describes Doba Levin's 19 years of pregnancy, childbearing and breast feeding as actions that divest her of ''autonomy.'' A superficial definition of the word would support this. As the mother of 14 children and a spiritual guide to many more, Levin is not independent in the sense that she is free to schedule her days as she chooses. But in terms of moral independence, she is powerful indeed. Corrine Coakley Cleveland
